learning_steps.description:
Learn how to use pg_hba.conf to manage authentication and enforce secure database access. This file controls:

• Which hosts can connect
• Which database users can connect
• Which databases they can access
• What authentication method is required
learning_steps.code:
# Example pg_hba.conf entries:
# TYPE  DATABASE        USER            ADDRESS                 METHOD
local   all             postgres                                peer
host    all             all             10.0.0.0/8              md5
host    all             all             0.0.0.0/0               reject

learning_steps.description:
Deploy a PostgreSQL Database in a Private Subnet:

1. Deploy a VM in a private subnet
2. Install and configure PostgreSQL
3. Configure pg_hba.conf for secure remote access
4. Create database users with appropriate permissions
5. Test connection from your API server (in public subnet)
6. Verify the database is NOT accessible from the internet

questions.prompt: What is pg_hba.conf and how does it control PostgreSQL authentication?
